meanings.definition: A second match between the same opponents.
meanings.sent1: After losing the first game, they scheduled a rematch to try again.
meanings.sent2: The rematch between the two teams ended in a tie this time.
meanings.sent3: The rematch was like a do-over for both teams, a chance to prove themselves.
meanings.sent4: The rematch felt like a battle of equals, each side giving their all.
meanings.sent5: The rematch was intense, with both teams determined to win.

meanings.definition: To have a second match against the same opponent.
meanings.sent1: They decided to rematch after the controversial first match.
meanings.sent2: She wants to rematch her rival to show her improvement.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly challenged his friend to rematch in a friendly game.
meanings.sent4: The players will rematch next week to settle the score.
meanings.sent5: The coach encouraged the team to rematch with a positive attitude.
